long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
This extension automates scrolling on webpages and switches to the next tab based on a list of links you provide. Follow the instructions below to use the extension effectively:

How to Use:
Add Links:
1.1 Click on the "Add Links" button in the control panel.
1.2 Enter the URLs of the pages you want the extension to scroll through.
1.3 Save the list of links.

Set Scroll Area (if required):
2.1 By default, the extension scrolls the entire page.
2.2 If the webpage is not scrollable (e.g., it has a scrollable frame or a specific element), you need to specify the scrollable area.
2.2.1 Inspect the webpage's HTML to identify the scrollable element (e.g., a frame, class, or ID).
2.2.2 For a class: Enter .classname (e.g., .scroll-container).
2.2.3 For an ID: Enter #idname (e.g., #scrollable-section).

Start Scrolling:
3.1 Go back to the control panel and click "Start Scrolling."
3.2 The extension will:
3.2.1 Scroll through the page based on the settings.
3.2.2 Automatically switch to the next tab from the list of links after completing the scroll.
3.2.3 Repeat the process for all links in the list.

Stop Scrolling:
4.1 To stop the auto-scrolling process, click "Stop Scrolling" in the control panel.
